intro: Cistanche trivalvis, commonly known as the desert candle, is a parasitic plant belonging to the Orobanchaceae family. It lacks chlorophyll and relies on host plants for nutrients, typically growing on the roots of various shrubs and trees. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers, often in clusters, and is native to arid regions of Asia, including China, Mongolia, and Russia. Its stem is fleshy and cylindrical, and it is known for its medicinal properties in traditional Chinese medicine. Cistanche trivalvis is also used in modern herbal supplements due to its potential health benefits.
